t: A Psalm of Fearless Trust in God.
The*pn Lord*s is my light and my salvation; Whom*ln shall I fear? The*ln Lord*s is the defense of my life; Whom*ln shall I dread?
When*ln evildoers came upon me to devour my flesh, My*ln adversaries and my enemies, they stumbled and fell.
Though*ln a host encamp against me, My*ln heart will not fear; Though*ln war arise against me, In*ln spite*i of*i this I shall be confident.

One*ln thing I have asked from the Lord,*s that I shall seek: That*ln I may dwell in the house of the Lord*s all the days of my life, To*ln behold the beauty of the Lord*s And*ln to meditate in His temple.
For*ln in the day of trouble He will conceal me in His tabernacle; In*ln the secret place of His tent He will hide me; He*ln will lift me up on a rock.
And*ln now my head will be lifted up above my enemies around me, And*ln I will offer in His tent sacrifices with shouts of joy; I*ln will sing, yes, I will sing praises to the Lord.*s
Hear,*ln O Lord,*s when I cry with my voice, And*ln be gracious to me and answer me.
When*iln You*i said,*i “Seek My face,” my heart said to You, “Your*ln face, O Lord,*s I shall seek.”
Do*ln not hide Your face from me, Do*ln not turn Your servant away in anger; You*ln have been my help; Do*ln not abandon me nor forsake me, O*ln God of my salvation!
For*ln my father and my mother have forsaken me, But*ln the Lord*s will take me up.
Teach*ln me Your way, O Lord,*s And*ln lead me in a level path Because*ln of my foes.
Do*ln not deliver me over to the desire of my adversaries, For*ln false witnesses have risen against me, And*ln such as breathe out violence.
I*iln would*i have*i despaired*i unless I had believed that I would see the goodness of the Lord*s In*ln the land of the living.
Wait*ln for the Lord;*s Be*ln strong and let your heart take courage; Yes,*ln wait for the Lord.*s
